channel.title: Drop list collision
channel.description:
http://jsfiddle.net/d8daM/1/
Could anyone help me understand why I can't make the words appear from left to right instead of top to bottom? IE each word/droplist has it's own row, but that doesnt work as when you try to move over mouse to the text(drop list appears) it collides the another ones.
What I am asking is how to make it appear from left to right, there would be around 5-7 text(each has it's own drop list).
Any help would be really appreciated.
Thanks

item.title: Drop list collision
item.dc:creator: @Zankza Zankza
item.description:
@Zankza wrote:

Thanks for your all guys concern and replies, I figured it out, with a small hint from friend.

I already knew about activating, same hover, same function, but it wasn’t the problem, the problem was that the the “academic” and “studentlife” weren’t on the same row.

Read full topic

item.title: Drop list collision
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ruby:

You explained what you were looking for pretty badly, try explaining it more clearly.

Both the “Academic” and “Student Life” dropdown menus are activating at the same time.

The problem is that you named them both “dropdown”, so if one activates, since the other is also named “dropdown” it will activate as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Drop list collision
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

You explained what you were looking for pretty badly, try explaining it more clearly.

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Wait, you want an inline drop list with each one having there own drop downs, I think?

Read full topic
